comment: The Legendre symbol for odd primes is ` 1 ` iff the number is not a multiple of the prime (in which case it is ` 0 ` , see ~ lgsne0 ) and the number is a quadratic residue ` mod P ` (it is ` -u 1 ` for nonresidues by the process of elimination from ~ lgsabs1 ). Given our definition of the Legendre symbol, this theorem is equivalent to Euler's criterion. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 15-Jun-2015.)
